p: Dengue and Zika are also arthropod‐borne viruses (arboviruses) that, like chikungunya, are transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes but are flaviviruses (genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae). All 3 arboviruses cause an initial fever‐arthralgia‐rash syndrome and are associated with neurological complications. 3, 4, 5 Given increasing reports of cocirculation and coinfection of the 3 arboviruses in the Americas, 6 the underlying viral aetiology in patients presenting with arbovirus‐associated neurological disease is not always clear. Therefore, understanding the similarities and differences between chikungunya‐, Zika‐, and dengue‐associated neurological diseases is of importance and will be addressed in this review.
